intro: Cirrhopetalum caespitosum, commonly known as the tufted bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact, tufted growth habit. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
